newsitem.title: USA: Black Sun Interactive extends 2-D and 3-D worlds.
newsitem.headline: Black Sun Interactive extends 2-D and 3-D worlds.

text.p: Black Sun Interactive executives said they will introduce new versions of their plug-ins and server software on Monday to offer enhanced features for communications in two and three dimensional space.

The Internet software company, based in Munich and San Francisco, said both the desktop client software and the server software will be available on Monday from its Web site at (http://www.blacksun.com).

The Black Sun Passport 2.0 Plug-In replaces CyberHub Client, is available for free and can be used to collaborate and conduct simultaneous conversations over computers connected to Internet browsers from Microsoft Corp or Netscape Communications Corp.

The company's Black Sun Community Server 2.0 can deliver advertisements to 2-D and 3-D community members in a variety of ways and includes the ability to moderate events and customize robots for a variety of roles.

The servier is priced starting at $1,500 for a 25-user license with 3-D community support and can scale up to 22,500 simultaneous users 3-D, or 15 million on 2-D only over a T3 communications link at 45 megabits, according to the company.
The server runs on Windows NT and several Unix versions.
